New Records: Andy Ibáñez hit a tiebreaking three-run double in Detroit’s four-run eighth inning, and the Tigers swept the Houston Astros with a 5-2 victory in Game 2 of their AL Wild Card Series.
Key Match Events: Andy Ibáñez’s clutch swing gave the Tigers a 5-2 lead in the eighth inning
Colt Keith reached on a two-out walk, and closer Josh Hader walked Spencer Torkelson to load the bases
Hader, who signed a $95 million, five-year contract with Houston in January, allowed three hits and walked two in 1 1/3 innings
Parker Meadows homered as Detroit ended Houston’s run of seven consecutive appearances in the AL Championship Series
Pre-Game Insights: Just making it to the playoffs seemed improbable before Detroit went 31-13 down the stretch in the regular season, helped along by the leadership of Hinch — who knows a little something about October success from his time with the Astros
Post-Match Reflections: The AL West champions failed to get the big hits they relied on in the regular season, but manufactured a pair of runs with hustle plays in the seventh
Eight of the first nine Wild Card Series since they began in 2002 have been sweeps
It’s the fourth sweep in postseason history for the Tigers, who previously swept the AL Championship Series in 1984, 2006 and 2012
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers will now head to Cleveland to take on the AL Central champions in a best-of-five AL Division Series. Game 1 is on Saturday
The Astros lost their seventh straight postseason game at home
Houston’s ALCS streak included four World Series appearances and two titles
